00014 #ifndef ULIB_FILECONFIG_H
00015 #define ULIB_FILECONFIG_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/file.h>
00018 #include <ulib/container/hash_map.h>
00019 
00020 class U_EXPORT UFileConfig : public UFile {
00021 public:
00022 
00023         static UString* str_yes;
00024         static UString* str_file;
00025         static UString* str_string;
00026 
00027         static void str_allocate();
00028 
00029         // COSTRUTTORI
00030 
00031         UFileConfig()
00032                 {
00033                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UFileConfig, "", 0)
00034 
00035                 UFile::map      = (char*)MAP_FAILED;
00036                 UFile::st_size  = 0;
00037                 UFile::map_size = 0;
00038 
00039                 if (str_yes == 0) str_allocate();
00040                 }
00041 
00042         ~UFileConfig()
00043                 {
00044                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UFileConfig)
00045 
00046                 if (table.capacity())
00047                         {
00048                         table.clear();
00049                         table.deallocate();
00050                         }
00051                 }
00052 
00053         // SERVICES
00054 
00055         bool loadVector(UVector<UString>& vec);
00056         bool loadTable(UHashMap<UString>& table);
00057 
00058         bool loadTable() { return loadTable(table); }
00059 
00060         bool load(const char* section = 0, uint32_t len = 0);
00061 
00062         // section management
00063 
00064         bool skip(char c = '#'); // skip space and line comment...
00065 
00066         char peek() { return _start[0]; }
00067 
00068         void reset()
00069                 {
00070                 U_TRACE(0, "UFileConfig::reset()")
00071 
00072                 _end    = data.end();
00073                 _size = (_end - _start);
00074                 }
00075 
00076         bool searchForObjectStream(const char* section = 0, uint32_t len = 0);
00077 
00078         // Wrapper for table
00079 
00080         UHashMap<UString> table;
00081 
00082         void clear()       {        table.clear(); }
00083         void deallocate()  {        table.deallocate(); }
00084         bool empty() const { return table.empty(); }
00085 
00086         UString      erase(const UString& key) { return table.erase(key); }
00087         UString operator[](const UString& key) { return table[key]; }
00088 
00089         // Facilities
00090 
00091         long readLong(const UString& key, long default_value = 0)
00092                 {
00093                 U_TRACE(0, "UFileConfig::readLong(%.*S,%ld)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(key), default_value)
00094 
00095                 UString value = table[key];
00096 
00097                 if (value.empty() == false) default_value = value.strtol();
00098 
00099                 U_RETURN(default_value);
00100                 }
00101 
00102         bool readBoolean(const UString& key)
00103                 {
00104                 U_TRACE(0, "UFileConfig::readBoolean(%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(key))
00105 
00106                 bool result = (table[key] == *str_yes);
00107 
00108                 U_RETURN(result);
00109                 }
00110 
00111         // Open a configuration file
00112 
00113         bool open();
00114         bool open(const UString& path)
00115                 {
00116                 U_TRACE(0, "UFileConfig::open(%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(path))
00117 
00118                 UFile::setPath(path);
00119 
00120                 return UFileConfig::open();
00121                 }
00122 
00123         // EXT
00124 
00125         // This implementation of a Configuration reads properties
00126         // from a legacy Windows initialization (.ini) file.
00127         //
00128         // The file syntax is implemented as follows.
00129         //   - a line starting with a semicolon is treated as a comment and ignored
00130         //   - a line starting with a square bracket denotes a section key [<key>]
00131         //   - every other line denotes a property assignment in the form
00132         //     <value key> = <value>
00133         //
00134         // The name of a property is composed of the section key and the value key,
00135         // separated by a period (<section key>.<value key>).
00136         //
00137         // Property names are not case sensitive. Leading and trailing whitespace is
00138         // removed from both keys and values.
00139 
00140         bool loadINI();
00141 
00142         // This implementation of a Configuration reads properties
00143         // from a Java-style properties file.
00144         //
00145         // The file syntax is implemented as follows.
00146         //   - a line starting with a hash '#' or exclamation mark '!' is treated as a comment and ignored
00147         //   - every other line denotes a property assignment in the form
00148         //     <key> = <value> or
00149         //     <key> : <value>
00150         //
00151         // Property names are case sensitive. Leading and trailing whitespace is
00152         // removed from both keys and values. A property name can neither contain
00153         // a colon ':' nor an equal sign '=' character.
00154 
00155         bool loadProperties();
00156 
00157 #ifdef DEBUG
00158         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00159 #endif
00160 
00161 protected:
00162         UString data;
00163         const char* _end;
00164         const char* _start;
00165         uint32_t _size;
00166 
00167 private:
00168         UFileConfig(const UFileConfig&) : UFile()  {}
00169         UFileConfig& operator=(const UFileConfig&) { return *this; }
00170 };
00171 
00172 #endif
